<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of send_all:
```c
static void
send_all (MHD_socket sock,
          const char *buf,
          size_t len)
{
  ssize_t ret;
  size_t off;

  make_blocking (sock);
  for (off = 0; off < len; off += (size_t) ret)
  {
    ret = send (sock,
                &buf[off],
#if ! defined(_WIN32) || defined(__CYGWIN__)
                len - off,
#else  /* Native W32 */
                (int) (len - off),
#endif /* Native W32 */
                0);
    if (0 > ret)
    {
      if (EAGAIN == errno)
      {
        ret = 0;
        continue;
      }
      break;
    }
    if (0 == ret)
      break;
  }
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags:
ret = send (sock,
                &buf[off],
#if ! defined(_WIN32) || defined(__CYGWIN__)
                len - off,
#else  /* Native W32 */
                (int) (len - off),
#endif /* Native W32 */
                0);
explanation: Rule 17.2 concerns direct or indirect calls to the same function. The send_all implementation contains no direct call to send_all, so the only possible indirect recursion would come through functions it calls. Therefore the calls to make_blocking(sock) and to send(...) should be investigated to ensure they do not (directly or indirectly) call send_all. Other fragments (function signature, local variable declarations, the for loop control and index update, errno checks, break/continue handling, and the EAGAIN handling) do not perform function calls that could trigger indirect recursion and so do not need investigation for Rule 17.2.
